mods.abstract: A monolithic corinthian free-standing column erected in 297 C.E., dedicated to Emperor Diocletian's victory in suppressing an Alexandrian revolt, man stands next to base (right foreground); City of Alexandria (background); "Edition Photoglob 5025. Alexandrie la Colonne Pompee." in white along bottom of print. (Number on object is 1/655).

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
